001/** 
002 * This controller provides functionality for viewing actions regarding the employees
003 * @author Isha Virk
004 */
005package src.controller;
006
007// import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;
008import javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent; 
009import javafx.fxml.FXML;
010import src.controller.useful_functions.user_role;
011
012import static src.controller.useful_functions.current_user_role;
013import static src.controller.useful_functions.switch_scene;
014
015import javafx.event.ActionEvent;
016
017/**
018 * This class provides functionality for viewing actions regarding the employees
019 */
020public class employee_data_controller {
021
022    /**
023     * This function switches back to the manager page
024     * @param event - Input trigger which occurs after the user hits the back button
025     */
026    @FXML
027    private void handle_back_click(ActionEvent event) {
028        switch_scene("GUI/manager_view.fxml", event);
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * This function switches to the add employee page
033     * @param event - Input trigger which occurs afrer the user hits the add employee button
034     */
035    @FXML
036    private void handle_add_click(ActionEvent event) {
037        switch_scene("GUI/new_employee.fxml", event);
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * This function switches to the update employee page
042     * @param event - Input trigger which occurs afrer the user hits the update employee button
043     */
044    @FXML
045    private void handle_update_click(ActionEvent event) {
046        switch_scene("GUI/update_employee.fxml", event);
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * This function switches to the remove employee page
051     * @param event - Input trigger which occurs afrer the user hits the remove employee button
052     */
053    @FXML
054    private void handle_remove_click(ActionEvent event) {
055        switch_scene("GUI/remove_employee.fxml", event);
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * This function switches to the employee record page
060     * @param event - Input trigger which occurs afrer the user hits the view employee records button
061     */
062    @FXML
063    private void handle_records_click(MouseEvent event) {
064        switch_scene("GUI/employee_records.fxml", event);
065    }
066
067
068    
069}
